intro: Streblosa palawanensis var. merrillii, commonly known as the Palawan streblosa, is a rare flowering plant endemic to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests, where it thrives in humid and shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth surface, while its stems are slender and woody. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
